snippet.title: Physical Assessment for Electrodiagnostic Medicine: eMedicine Physical Medicine
snippet.description: Physical Assessment for Electrodiagnostic Medicine: eMedicine Physical Medicine Overview: As with any meaningful medical consultation, the electrodiagnostic medicine consultation must begin with obtaining a pertinent history and performing a physical examination. The history is not discussed in this article, but it obviously forms the basis of ...

snippet.title: Toxic Neuropathy : Article by Jonathan S Rutchik, MD, MPH
snippet.description: Toxic Neuropathy : Article by Jonathan S Rutchik, MD, MPH Toxic Neuropathy - Lewis P. Rowland, in Merritt�s Textbook of Neurology, defines the terms peripheral neuropathy and polyneuropathy as describing �the clinical syndrome of weakness, sensory loss and impairment of reflexes caused by diffuse lesions of peripheral nerves.� The diagnosis most often is based on the clinical picture and is confirmed with electrodiagnostic techniques, most commonly electromyography (EMG) and nerve conduction studies. Facial nerve and blink reflex testing also are used commonly. Apparatuses, such as the neurometer, vibrometer, and sensory ...
